feed.title: "topnews" via Gareth Lloyd in Google Reader

entry.title: Nato expected to command Libya ops
entry.summary: Britain has signalled that it expects Nato to take charge of all international military operations over Libya, including air strikes on Colonel Muammar Gaddafi's ground forces.

entry.title: Libya: British planes bomb Gaddafi tanks for first time
entry.summary: Britain has launched a concerted attack for the first time on pro-Gaddafi loyalists besieging the key Libyan city of Ajdabiya, using laser guided weapons to destroy tanks on the ground.

entry.title: Nato expected to command Libya ops
entry.summary: Britain has signalled that it expects Nato to take charge of all international military operations over Libya, including air strikes on Colonel Muammar Gaddafi's ground forces.

entry.title: Capello defends captaincy situation
entry.summary: England manager Fabio Capello says he can understand why Rio Ferdinand may be upset at losing the captaincy to John Terry, but insists that it was a decision he needed to make.

entry.title: Kenny sees off Hoy
entry.summary: Jason Kenny will ride for Track Cycling World Championships gold in Apeldoorn, Holland after defeating Great Britain team-mate Sir Chris Hoy in the men's sprint semi-final.

entry.title: Britain condemns Syrian violence
entry.summary: Britain condemned the latest violence in Syria which has reportedly seen dozens of anti-government demonstrators shot dead by the security forces.

entry.title: Israel to deploy 'Iron Dome' anti-rocket system
entry.summary: Israel will deploy its "Iron Dome" multi-million-pound missile defence system in southern Israel for the first time next week in the wake of rocket attacks from Gaza, officials said on Friday.

entry.title: Libya: Proof we are winning MoD footage of airstrikes on Gaddafi tanks
entry.summary: In a meeting between five African heads of State and Libyan representatives, the union has agreed to act as mediators for any talks that take place between the government and the rebels.

entry.title: Procrastination day put off till tomorrow
entry.summary: The world feted international procrastination day on Friday, but its French founder insisted he had no issues with people putting it off until tomorrow.

entry.title: Syrian protests spread throughout country
entry.summary: The situation in Syria deteriorated sharply on Friday as protests spread for the first time throughout the country and the security forces were reported to have killed dozens of people.

entry.title: Bird coroner raises medics concerns
entry.summary: Concerns about ambulance staff being held back from casualty scenes have been raised by the coroner who held inquests into the deaths of mass killer Derrick Bird and the 12 people he shot dead.

entry.title: Bird coroner raises medics concerns
entry.summary: Concerns about ambulance staff being held back from casualty scenes have been raised by the coroner who held inquests into the deaths of mass killer Derrick Bird and the 12 people he shot dead.

entry.title: Tributes to Afghan blast soldiers
entry.summary: The families of two British soldiers killed in an explosion in Afghanistan six days before they were due to return home have paid tribute to their loved ones.

entry.title: PM: N-plant situation is very grave
entry.summary: A suspected breach in the reactor at the stricken Fukushima nuclear plant could mean more serious radioactive contamination, Japanese officials have warned.

entry.title: Serena serves up a rear-ly hot ad
entry.summary: SAUCY Tennis champ Serena Williams looks smashing in red hot racy TV advert

entry.title: Two Brits killed in Afghan blast named
entry.summary: SOLDIERS killed in Afghanistan named by MOD as Major Matthew Collins and Lance Sergeant Mark Burgan

entry.title: Libya: supporters rally in Gaddafi's home town Sirte
entry.summary: In the early hours groups of men paraded through the streets of Sirte, the town where Col Muammar Gaddafi grew up and has since built into a modern city.

entry.title: Tributes to Afghan blast soldiers
entry.summary: The families of two British soldiers killed in an explosion in Afghanistan six days before they were due to return home have paid tribute to their loved ones.

entry.title: Bird coroner raises medics concerns
entry.summary: Concerns about ambulance staff being held back from casualty scenes have been raised by the coroner who held inquests into the deaths of mass killer Derrick Bird and the 12 people he shot dead.

entry.title: PM: N-plant situation is very grave
entry.summary: A suspected breach in the reactor at the stricken Fukushima nuclear plant could mean more serious radioactive contamination, Japanese officials have warned.

entry.title: Zimbabwe's Anglicans forced to worship in pubs
entry.summary: Tens of thousands of Zimbabwe's Anglicans are being forced to worship in pubs, tents and private schools while their churches stand empty, shuttered by a controversial bishop loyal to President Robert Mugabe.

entry.title: Libya: David Cameron urges Col Gaddafi's allies to abandon the leader
entry.summary: David Cameron has urged Colonel Muammar Gaddafi's political allies and military chiefs to abandon the Libyan regime and help bring down the dictator.

entry.title: Tornado crew describe raid on Libya
entry.summary: An RAF crewman has given the first account of a raid over Libya in which his Tornado destroyed four tanks belonging to forces loyal to Col Gaddafi.

entry.title: Nick Clegg gaffe over winter fuel payment cuts
entry.summary: Deputy Prime Minister denies winter fuel payment cuts confirmed by Treasury

entry.title: Two British soldiers killed in Afghanistan six days before they were due home are named
entry.summary: The families of two British soldiers killed in an explosion in Afghanistan six days before they were due to return home have paid tribute to their loved ones.

entry.title: The week in pictures: 25 March 2011
entry.summary: A round-up of our favourite photographs of the week.

entry.title: Gunman unlawfully killed 12 victims
entry.summary: Taxi driver Derrick Bird unlawfully killed the 12 victims he shot dead before he committed suicide, an inquest jury has ruled.

entry.title: Sian probe: Second victim hunted
entry.summary: Another victim who is believed to have been killed by the murderer of missing nightclubber Sian O'Callaghan went missing "several years ago", detectives have revealed.

entry.title: Night Stalker given life sentence
entry.summary: One of Night Stalker Delroy Grant's elderly victims bravely faced him across a courtroom as he was jailed for life.

entry.title: Motorists 'missing out' on duty cut
entry.summary: Many motorists are missing out on the 1p a litre fuel duty reduction announced by the Chancellor in the Budget, according to AA figures.

entry.title: Tesco limits Asda price check deal
entry.summary: Supermarket giant Tesco has backtracked on an offer to reimburse shoppers who can buy products cheaper at Asda after hundreds of people claimed refunds.

entry.title: McLaren drivers hail improved car
entry.summary: Jenson Button and Lewis Hamilton were both wearing broad smiles as some of the doom and gloom that has recently surrounded McLaren lifted on Friday.

entry.title: New Zealand stun South Africa
entry.summary: New Zealand secured a surprise World Cup semi-final berth with a thrilling 49-run victory over South Africa in Dhaka.

entry.title: British trio through
entry.summary: Great Britain's Victoria Pendleton, Jessica Varnish and Becky James safely qualified for the knockout stages of the women's sprint on day three of the Track Cycling World Championships.

entry.title: Saints lift Eastmond suspension
entry.summary: St Helens have lifted their suspension on England half-back Kyle Eastmond after warning him over his future conduct.

entry.title: Redknapp: Bale was fit when he left
entry.summary: Tottenham boss Harry Redknapp insists his Welsh winger Gareth Bale was fit to play when he was released for international duty at the weekend.

entry.title: Tributes to Afghan blast soldiers
entry.summary: The families of two British soldiers killed in an explosion in Afghanistan six days before they were due to return home have paid tribute to their loved ones.

entry.title: Bird coroner raises medics concerns
entry.summary: Concerns about ambulance staff being held back from casualty scenes have been raised by the coroner who held inquests into the deaths of mass killer Derrick Bird and the 12 people he shot dead.

entry.title: Judge returns Texas beauty queen's crown
entry.summary: A 17-year-old Texas beauty queen allegedly told to "get off the tacos" after gaining weight has had her crown returned by a judge after a jury ruled that she was wrongly stripped of her title.

entry.title: Madonna abandons Malawi school project
entry.summary: Madonna has abandoned plans to build a boarding school for 400 girls in Malawi despite spending $3.8 million (2.4 million) on the project.

entry.title: Libya: Gaddafi regime tries - and fails - to find proof of civilian victims
entry.summary: The Libyan government followed up claims that close to 100 civilians had died in the allied air strikes by taking journalists to see signs of damage to civilian properties on Friday.

entry.title: Animal pictures of the week: 25 March 2011
entry.summary: All creatures great and small in our popular animal gallery.

entry.title: Libya: Gaddafi zealot Omar Ahmed Sodani trial over WPC Yvonne Fletcher embassy killing
entry.summary: Omar Ahmed Sodani shuffled on to the parade ground in a pair of Crocs, hands clasped and eyes blindfolded with a Gaddafi green scarf, led by a balaclava-clad rebel fighter.

entry.title: PM: N-plant situation is very grave
entry.summary: A suspected breach in the reactor at the stricken Fukushima nuclear plant could mean more serious radioactive contamination, Japanese officials have warned.

entry.title: BRA-vo for the flesh mob
entry.summary: CHEEKY display as women celebrate body diversity - by stripping off to their smalls

entry.title: Tiniest horse is having a ball
entry.summary: WORLD'S smallest horse will celebrate his big day - turning one - with new book

entry.title: Libya: rebel families flee Ajdabiya
entry.summary: There was a stream of pickups, cars and trucks with families fleeing the fighting in Ajdabiya on Friday following the night of bombing by RAF Tornado jets.

entry.title: Libyan rebel commander admits his fighters have al-Qaeda links
entry.summary: Abdel-Hakim al-Hasidi, the Libyan rebel leader, has said jihadists who fought against allied troops in Iraq are on the front lines of the battle against Muammar Gaddafi's regime.

entry.title: Nicolas Sarkozy gives celebrity philosopher unofficial foreign post
entry.summary: President Nicolas Sarkozy has given the waning influence of France's Left Bank intellectuals a huge boost by giving the country's best-known philosopher, Bernard-Henri Lvy the role of "unofficial foreign minister".

entry.title: The Big Lunch: how to get involved..
entry.summary: LAST year, there were thousands of street parties up and down the country.

entry.title: Wannabe model dubbed the Cheryl Cole of Reading convicted of assault after late night bar brawl
entry.summary: Unemployed Kaycie Yates, 20, hit Zoe Rox with a glass bottle in a Reading bar. She was in a BBC documentary about young women with a non-existent work-ethic.

entry.title: House price leap as buyers seek security amid Arab turmoil
entry.summary: Central London property prices have jumped unexpectedly at the start of the year as wealthy buyers flood into the capital amid global turmoil

entry.title: Arsene Wenger keeping quiet over goalkeeper change
entry.summary: Arsenal boss refused to confirm whether he would now axe Manuel Almunia in favour of veteran Jens Lehmann

entry.title: US troops in Germany banned from wearing uniform in public
entry.summary: American troops serving in Germany have been banned from wearing uniform in public following the shooting dead of two US servicemen at Frankfurt airport.

entry.title: Polish children killed by Second World War bomb explosion
entry.summary: Two Polish children have been killed by an explosion of munitions left over from the bitter battles of the Second World War.

entry.title: MPs launch new bid to cut abortion rate
entry.summary: The number of abortions carried out would fall under new laws to be proposed in Parliament next week, campaigners have claimed.

entry.title: The Big Lunch: a one day get-together for neighbours
entry.summary: Environmental education charity the Eden Project started The Big Lunch because it believes we are better equipped to tackle the challenges that we face when we face them together.

entry.title: The Big Lunch: the story so far
entry.summary: LAST year Big Lunches stretched from Jersey to Bangor, from Peckham to the Shetland Isles.

entry.title: The Big Lunch: Apple Streusel Cake
entry.summary: Shaun the Sheep and Mumsnet give this easy, tasty recipe the big thumbs up when it comes to stirring up some fun in the kitchen with the kids.

entry.title: The Big Lunch: Kids bunting challenge
entry.summary: Colourful lines of bunting, fluttering in the wind is the traditional backdrop to any great outdoor party.

entry.title: Oops! Nick Clegg in TV blunder
entry.summary: NICK Clegg faced embarrassment last night after a private joke about his increasing political closeness to David Cameron was picked up by a TV microphone.

entry.title: David Cameron urges greedy garages who ignored budget cuts to lower petrol prices
entry.summary: PRIME Minister David Cameron urged garages to pass the tax reduction set by George Osborne's budget today as greedy garages failed to lower prices.

entry.title: Royal Wedding: BBC coverage to be anchored by Huw Edwards
entry.summary: One Show presenter Miss Jones, pictured, and Fearne Cotton are surprise choices to cover the Royal Wedding. Newsreader Huw Edwards anchors the coverage on April 29.

entry.title: Disabled woman 'died of dehydration' after mother who shunned all help to care for her passes away
entry.summary: Stefania Woolf, 67, from Hertfordshire, may have had a brain or heart condition, leaving daughter Samantha - who had brain damage - unable to care for herself.

entry.title: Bill Gates and Warren Buffett ask India's billionaires to give to charity
entry.summary: Bill Gates and Warren Buffett, the world's greatest living philanthropists, have asked India's growing number of billionaires to give more of their fortunes to charity.

entry.title: Nathan and Elisa Bond in heartbreaking fight to survive after both diagnosed with advanced cancer
entry.summary: Elisa and Nathan Bond, of Brooklyn, New York, have been told they could have just five years to live after both were diagnosed with advanced cancer.

entry.title: Elizabeth Taylor portrait by Andy Warhol expected to fetch 13m at auction
entry.summary: An Andy Warhol portrait of Elizabeth Taylor is to go under the hammer at a New York City auction where it is estimated to fetch 20 million dollars (13 million).

entry.title: Such dirty pretty things at the Wellcome Collection
entry.summary: Although it is dominated by excrement, disease and garbage, the Wellcome Collection's latest show avoids the muddy thinking characteristic of many thematic exhibitions

entry.title: Weather forecasters predict Britain set for warmest weekend this year
entry.summary: Met Office research facilities in Charlwood, near Gatwick, and Chivenot, north Devon, both recorded temperatures of 19.6C - well above the March average of 10C.

entry.summary: Many of the workers at Fukushima Dai-ichi, who have also been dubbed the Atomic Samurai, were taken to hospital after coming in to contact with contaminated water.

entry.title: Foursquare has doubled its users since Facebook Places launched says chief
entry.summary: Dennis Crowley, Foursquare's chief, has denied that the launch of Facebook's rival location service, 'Places', has negatively affected his service's membership, saying its registered users has doubled since the social network upped the ante.

entry.title: Striding not shuffling stops spills on slippery surfaces
entry.summary: Walking purposely across slippery surfaces such as ice and oil is less likely to cause you to slip than slowly shuffling along, a new study suggests.

entry.title: Thieves use Google Earth to steal copper cabling costing railway companies 1million
entry.summary: The gang looked up more than 4,000 images to pinpoint the best places to steal the wiring from across central England, putting at risk the lives of thousands of train passengers.

entry.summary: The ten-year project would transform the struggling town of Falmouth, Cornwall, into a 'thriving gateway' to the south West.

entry.title: Mother died at Queen's Hospital Romford, after being given Caesarean section on ward floor by staff who tried to resuscitate her with disconnected oxygen mask
entry.summary: Two midwives have been suspended at Queen's Hospital, Romford, Essex, after 27-year-old Tessebum Ali - known as Sareena - died giving birth to a stillborn daughter.

entry.title: Springing into the weekend... seasonal sun to last the whole weekend as forecasters say bright spells will hold into next week

entry.title: Einstein, the world's smallest horse, gets set for first birthday

entry.title: Woman who fed husband poisoned milkshake convicted
entry.summary: Nancy Kissel, a 46-year-old American who bludgeoned her husband to death after feeding him a drug-laced milkshake, has been found guilty of his death in a retrial in Hong Kong.

entry.title: Petrol prices fall, but not by full 1p
entry.summary: Petrol prices failed to fall by the full 1p cut that George Osborne promised, according to figures which demonstrated how drivers are saving a mere 15p a week by the Chancellor's major Budget giveaway.

entry.title: North Korea's food stocks running dry, UN warns
entry.summary: North Korea's government food distribution programme will run dry in May and put one-quarter of the country's 24 million people at risk of starvation, the United Nations has warned.

entry.summary: An extra 120,000 people will pay the top rate 50p tax will increase over the next five years because the threshold at which it is paid will not increase in line with inflation.

entry.summary: Official documents suggested the Budget's petrol price and income tax cuts will be eclipsed by a toxic combination of soaring living costs tiny wage increases.

entry.summary: Some garages even cynically put up prices by a penny on Wednesday, the day of the Budget, so they could claim to have cut them when the reduction hit at 6pm.

entry.title: Live: Bloody Sunday families shown Saville report
entry.summary: 9.40 BST On a January morning 38 years ago, 13 protesters died at the hands of British paratroopers and 14 were injured, one so seriously he died four months later. For many of their relatives, the years since have been dominated by the search for truth about what happened during 25 chaotic minutes in central Londonderry.

entry.title: Benayoun could prompt Anfield exodus
entry.summary: Yossi Benayoun has taken a significant step towards leaving Liverpool for Chelsea by agreeing in principle a four-year contract with the Barclays Premier League champions.

entry.title: Inflation eases as food prices begin to fall
entry.summary: Inflation eased in May to 3.4 per cent from a 17-month high the previous month, helped by weaker rises in food and petrol prices.

entry.title: Emails prove BP systematically put safety at risk
entry.summary: Congressional investigators have published a series of internal BP memos which they say proves that the British company systematically and negligently put safety at risk on the Deepwater Horizon oil rig in order to increase profits.

entry.title: Uzbekistan closes borders to refugees
entry.summary: Uzbekistan last night closed its borders to refugees fleeing neighbouring Kyrgyzstan as the numbers killed in the ethnic violence spiralled and aid agencies reported fresh allegations of atrocities from the survivors.

entry.title: BNP leader invited to meet Queen at Buckingham Palace garden party

entry.title: News Corp reaches for the Sky with takeover offer
entry.summary: News Corporation, the media group headed by Rupert Murdoch, confirmed this morning that it had made an offer to take full control of BSkyB, the satellite broadcaster in which it has a 39 per cent stake.

entry.title: Taleban zone's mineral riches may rival Saudi Arabia, says Pentagon
entry.summary: Afghanistan is sitting on mineral resources worth $1 trillion and could become one of the world$s most important mining centres, the Pentagon announced yesterday, as it tried to drum up foreign investment and wean the country off the opium trade.

entry.title: Gaza crossing points opened as Israel bows to international pressure
entry.summary: Israel bowed to international pressure yesterday when it agreed to reopen crossing points into Gaza for everyday goods.
